titles.en: Chapter 75 – The Fitra (Obligatory Zakat payable on the 1<sup>st</sup> Shawwal)

titles.ar: بَابُ مَا يَجِبُ عَلَى النَّاسِ إِذَا صَحَّ عِنْدَهُمُ الرُّؤْيَةُ يَوْمَ الْفِطْرِ بَعْدَ مَا أَصْبَحُوا صَائِمِينَ
titles.en: Chapter 73 – What is Obligated upon the people when the sighting (of the crescent) holds true with them on the day of Al-Fitr, after they had woken up Fasting

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: ضعيف - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (16/411)

narrator_chain.text: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ أَحْمَدَ عَنِ السَّيَّارِيِّ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ إِسْمَاعِيلَ الرَّازِيِّ عَنْ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ الثَّانِي ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ

text: قُلْتُ لَهُ جُعِلْتُ فِدَاكَ مَا تَقُولُ فِي الصَّوْمِ فَإِنَّهُ قَدْ رُوِيَ أَنَّهُمْ لَا يُوَفَّقُونَ لِصَوْمٍ فَقَالَ أَمَا إِنَّهُ قَدْ أُجِيبَتْ دَعْوَةُ الْمَلَكِ فِيهِمْ قَالَ فَقُلْتُ وَ كَيْفَ ذَلِكَ جُعِلْتُ فِدَاكَ قَالَ إِنَّ النَّاسَ لَمَّا قَتَلُوا الْحُسَيْنَ صَلَوَاتُ اللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ أَمَرَ اللَّهُ تَبَارَكَ وَ تَعَالَى مَلَكاً يُنَادِي أَيَّتُهَا الْأُمَّةُ الظَّالِمَةُ الْقَاتِلَةُ عِتْرَةَ نَبِيِّهَا لَا وَفَّقَكُمُ اللَّهُ لِصَوْمٍ وَ لَا لِفِطْرٍ .

en.hubeali: Muhammad Bin yahya, from Muhammad Bin Ahmad, from Al Sayyari, from Muhammad Bin Simail Al Qazy,

(It has been narrated) from Abu Ja’far<sup>asws</sup> the 2<sup>nd</sup>, said, ‘I said to him<sup>asws</sup>, ‘May I be sacrificed for you<sup>asws</sup>! What are you<sup>asws</sup> saying regarding the Fast, for it is being reported that they (people) would never harmonise for the Fasting?’ So he<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘But it is the supplication of the Angel which has been Answered with regards to them’. So I said, ‘And how is that? May I be sacrificed for you<sup>asws</sup>’. He<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘The people, when they killed Al-Husayn<sup>asws</sup>, Allah<sup>azwj</sup> Blessed and High Commanded an Angel who called out: ‘O you unjust community! The one which killed the family of its Prophet! Allah<sup>azwj</sup> will neither harmonise you for Fasting nor for (Eid) Al-Fitr’.
en.sarwar: 1. Muhammad ibn Yahya has narrated from Muhammad ibn Ahmad from al-Sayyariy from Muhammad ibn Isma‘il al-Raziy who has said the following: “I once asked abu Ja‘far, the 2nd, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, ‘I pray to Allah to keep my soul in service for your cause, what do you say about fasting? It is narrated that they never unite in the matter of fasting? He (the Imam) said, ‘It is because the prayer of the angel is answered about them? I (the narrator) then asked, ‘How is that, I pray to Allah to keep my soul in service for your cause?’ He (the Imam) replied, ‘When people murdered al-Husayn, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, Allah, the most Blessed, the most High, commanded an angel to announce, “O nation who has done injustice to itself, the killer of the descendents of its prophet, Allah will not unite you in the matter of fasting and al-Fitr?””

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: مجهول - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (6/411)

narrator_chain.text: أَحْمَدُ بْنُ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ الْحُسَيْنِ عَنْ عَمْرِو بْنِ عُثْمَانَ عَنْ حَنَانِ بْنِ سَدِيرٍ عَنْ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ دِينَارٍ عَنْ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ

text: قَالَ يَا عَبْدَ اللَّهِ مَا مِنْ عِيدٍ لِلْمُسْلِمِينَ أَضْحًى وَ لَا فِطْرٍ إِلَّا وَ هُوَ يُجَدِّدُ لآِلِ مُحَمَّدٍ فِيهِ حُزْناً قُلْتُ وَ لِمَ ذَاكَ قَالَ لِأَنَّهُمْ يَرَوْنَ حَقَّهُمْ فِي يَدِ غَيْرِهِمْ .

en.hubeali: Ahmad Bin Muhammad, from Ali Bin Al Husayn, from Amro Bin Usman, from Hanan Bin Sadeyr, from Abdullah Bin Dinar,

(It has been narrated) from Abu Ja’far<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘O Abdullah! There is none from an Eid of the Muslims, be it Al-Azha, or Fitr, except that it renews grief to the Progeny<sup>asws</sup> of Muhammad<sup>saww</sup> in it’. I said, ‘And why is that so?’ He<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘Because they<sup>asws</sup> are seeing their<sup>asws</sup> rights in the hands of others’.
en.sarwar: 2. Ahmad ibn Muhammad has narrated from Ali ibn al-Husayn from ‘Amr ibn ‘Uthman from Hanan ibn Sadir from ‘Abd Allah ibn Dinar who has said the following: “Abu Ja’far, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, has said, ‘O ‘Abd Allah, every ‘Id, like al-Adha’ or al-Fitr that comes renews the sadness for Ale (family of) Muhammad, O Allah, grant compensation to Muhammad and his family worthy of their services to Your cause?’ I then asked, ‘Why is it so?’ He (the Imam) replied, ‘Because they see their rights in the hands of others?”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: ضعيف - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (6/412)

narrator_chain.text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ مُحَمَّدٍ عَمَّنْ ذَكَرَهُ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ سُلَيْمَانَ عَنْ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ لَطِيفٍ التَّفْلِيسِيِّ عَنْ رَزِينٍ قَالَ

text: قَالَ أَبُو عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) لَمَّا ضُرِبَ الْحُسَيْنُ بْنُ عَلِيٍّ ( عليه السلام ) بِالسَّيْفِ فَسَقَطَ رَأْسُهُ ثُمَّ ابْتُدِرَ لِيُقْطَعَ رَأْسُهُ نَادَى مُنَادٍ مِنْ بُطْنَانِ الْعَرْشِ أَلَا أَيَّتُهَا الْأُمَّةُ الْمُتَحَيِّرَةُ الضَّالَّةُ بَعْدَ نَبِيِّهَا لَا وَفَّقَكُمُ اللَّهُ لِأَضْحًى وَ لَا لِفِطْرٍ
قَالَ ثُمَّ قَالَ أَبُو عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) فَلَا جَرَمَ وَ اللَّهِ مَا وُفِّقُوا وَ لَا يُوَفَّقُونَ حَتَّى يَثْأَرَ ثَائِرُ الْحُسَيْنِ ( عليه السلام ) .

en.hubeali: Ali Bin Muhammad, from the one who mentioned it, from Muhammad Bin Suleyment, from Abdullah Bin Lateef Al Tafleesy, from Razeyn who said,

‘Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘When Al-Husayn Bin Ali<sup>asws</sup> was struck with the sword, so his<sup>asws</sup> head fell, so they began to cut off his<sup>asws</sup> head, a Caller called out from the middle of the Throne: ‘Indeed! O you confused community, the Strayed ones after its Prophet<sup>saww</sup>! Allah<sup>azwj</sup> will neither Let you be harmonised for (Eid) Al-Azha nor (Eid) Al-Fitr’.

He (the narrator) said, ‘Then Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘So, there is no doubt, by Allah<sup>azwj</sup>! They are not harmonised, nor would they be harmonising until He<sup>azwj</sup> Avenges the revenge of Al-Husayn<sup>asws</sup>’.
en.sarwar: 3. Ali ibn Muhammad has narrated from those whom he has mentioned from Muhammad ibn Sulayman from ‘Abd Allah ibn Latif al- Taflisiy from Zurarah who has said the following: “Abu ‘Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, has said, ‘When al-Husayn, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, was hit with the sword and his head fell, he (the killer) rushed to cut off his head, and an announcer announced from the depth of the Throne, “O straying nation in confusion after its prophet, Allah will not unite you in al-Adha’ and al-Fitr ‘Id?” He (the narrator) has said that abu ‘Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, then said, ‘Thereafter, by Allah, they did not unite and will not unite until justice about the case of murdering al- Husayn, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, is done?”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: مجهول - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (16/412)

narrator_chain.text: الْحُسَيْنُ بْنُ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنِ الْحَرَّانِيِّ عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ النَّوْفَلِيِّ قَالَ

text: قُلْتُ لِأَبِي الْحَسَنِ ( عليه السلام ) إِنِّي أَفْطَرْتُ يَوْمَ الْفِطْرِ عَلَى تِينٍ وَ تَمْرَةٍ فَقَالَ لِي جَمَعْتَ بَرَكَةً وَ سُنَّةً .

en.hubeali: Al Husayn Bin Muhamad, from Al Harrany, from Ali Bin Muhammad Al Nowfaly, who said,
‘I said to Abu Al-Hassan<sup>asws</sup>, ‘I broke the Fast of the day of Al-Fitr upon figs and dates’. So he<sup>asws</sup> said to me: ‘You gathered together a Blessing and a Sunnah’.
en.sarwar: 4. Al-Husayn ibn Muhammad has narrated from al-Harraniy from Ali ibn Muhammad al-Nawfaliy who has said the following: “I once said to abu al-Hassan, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, ‘I used fig and dates for breaking my fast? He (the Imam) said, ‘You have brought together blessing and a noble tradition?”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: مجهول - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (6/412)

narrator_chain.text: سَهْلُ بْنُ زِيَادٍ عَنْ يَعْقُوبَ بْنِ يَزِيدَ عَنْ يَحْيَى بْنِ الْمُبَارَكِ عَنْ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ جَبَلَةَ عَنْ إِسْحَاقَ بْنِ عَمَّارٍ أَوْ غَيْرِهِ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ

text: كَانَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ ( صلى الله عليه وآله ) إِذَا أُتِيَ بِطِيبٍ يَوْمَ الْفِطْرِ بَدَأَ بِنِسَائِهِ .

en.hubeali: Sahl Bin Ziyad, from Yaqoub Bin Yazeed, from Yahya Bin Al Mubarak, from Abdullah Bin Jabala, from Is’haq Bin Ammar, or someone else,

(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘Rasool-Allah<sup>saww</sup>, whenever they came to him<sup>saww</sup> with perfume on the day of Al-Fitr, began with his<sup>saww</sup> wives’.
en.sarwar: 5. Sahl ibn Ziyad has narrated from Ya’qub ibn Yazid from Yahya ibn al-Mubarak from ‘Abd Allah ibn Jabalah from Ishaq ibn ‘Ammar or others who has said the following: “Abu ‘Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, has said that if the Messenger of Allah, O Allah, grant compensation to Muhammad and his family worthy of their services to Your cause, would receive any perfumes on the day of al-Fitr, he would first present it to his wives?’
